options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

What is your overall assessment of this course?

I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar was the only format.
n/a
Seminar

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to critically evaluate life writing and the authors' motives. The course also taught me different styles of life writing, starting with traditional autobiographies and ending with obituaries and body life writing. I also significantly improved my writing skills, trying different styles of writing and receiving specific and personal feedback.

I enjoyed English more as a result of this class. I used to hate English, but Professor Maria made the course more enjoyable by broadening my perspective on not just English but on what lens to view the world through.
Writing in a more conversational tone

I learned a lot about how to structure my essays and how to shorten my sentences in order to develop a stronger analytical argument. I also enjoyed learning about Life Writing and its universality, how we are surrounded by all forms and modes of what one might consider autobiographical or life writing.

Content examined how individuals use writing to narrate their lives; Assignments instructed students to consider the various implications autobiography has on how an individual identifies their purpose and experiences in life; Students taught how to analyze writings and write a college-level research paper using said analysis and individual contribution; Students also encouraged to consider how they can shape their own life using writing

This course helped me develop various writing skills, such as stating and supporting claims. Additionally, I learned how to conduct research for a research paper, and this course strengthened my overall confidence in academic writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The main strength of this class is its level of organization and the diverse selection of texts. The class can be further improved by providing more opportunities to practice writing and more texts to analyze so that students get more perspectives on the topic discussed.

Some of the readings were kind of confusing because they were unrelated. I would read some of them and expect there to be a connection for next class but sometimes it wasn't there so I didn't understand that part. The discussions were very good and brought many interesting points to me that I hadn't thought about before.
I liked the size of the class because it allowed for more thoughtful discussions.

I think it was really strong in the sense of it being a small live seminar where all were encouraged to participate and share their ideas. I do think that, at times, some individuals in the class would overpower class discussion and others wouldn't speak, so maybe if there was more of a balance of voices, the class would be even better.

Strengths: Fantastic instructor who is very knowledgeable and eager to help students learn and work at their own pace to understand the material; Reading material was culturally diverse and socially relevant; Many opportunities to seek and receive assistance with your assignments; Feedback is very clear and effective; Professor is very flexible and accommodating to students and the class environment
Weakness: None, I enjoyed everything about this class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course's adaptation to COVID was successful.

Having virtual live seminar was very nice. It was good to be forced to go on and talk to people I usually wouldn't see. It also held me accountable to attend class. It was very interactive and Professor Galindo was always reachable and willing to meet and be flexible. She really understood how difficult the current situation was and knew that we were trying.
It was nice having breakout rooms and I liked the student-led discussions (as well as the final project).

I think that having our microphones turned on during class discussions was helpful in creating more fluidity in conversation, and I think that that could help reduce the awkward silences that happened every once in a while in our class.

Professor was very flexible with varied class environment and was willing to amend reading and writing assignments/deadlines so that students could best make use of their time and effort; Professor encouraged discussion and collaboration between students by using breakout room activities and peer review exercises; Professor created a safe and motivating class environment which allowed students to lead discussions without fear of rejection or intimidation

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, it is a good foundation for building writing skills.
Yes, the course explores the topic of life writing from different angles and provides many opportunities to practice writing
Yes, I recommend this course because it really improves your writing in a non-stressful way.
Yes. The professor was amazing and the class atmosphere was very supportive and intellectually stimulating.

I would recommend this class because it really helped my essay writing, while also being interesting and engaging in subject matter. Because we read so many works from different writers and historical figures from diverse and different backgrounds, I was always engaged in class and was never bored.

Yes, absolutely! Professor Galindo is one of the best instructors I have ever had. She is incredibly kind and intelligent and cares very much for her students. Her understanding of the course material inspires students to approach the reading with a unique and fresh perspective. I was hesitant at first to enroll in the class because
I thought I would not enjoy the material, but Professor Galindo easily transformed that hesitation into the utmost enthusiasm. She cares that students not only understand the class material but that they also are able to apply the learnings to their own lives, be it personally and academically. Best class this semester!
Absolutely. This was a fantastic and engaging course, and proved to be beneficial without being overly strenuous.
